channel.description: Feed from Guardian - Middle East - with images and summaries

item.title: Australian women held in Syrian camp say they would accept children returning home separately
item.description:
Exclusive: Some of the 11 mothers detained in Kurdish-controlled al-Roj camp say they want Australian government to repatriate children at any cost Families in convoy from Syrian camp warned they would be attacked unless they turned around Follow our Australia news live blog for latest updates Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Australian women detained in north-east Syria over ties to Islamic State fighters said they would accept separation from their children if it me...

item.title: The 23 Australian children stuck in Syria are not responsible for their parents. They need our governmentâ€™s support to return | Donald Rothwell
item.description:
If the circumstances of those from Roj camp become even more perilous, the Albanese government may be forced to intervene Follow our Australia news live blog for latest updates Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Ever since news broke that 34 Australians were leaving Roj camp in north-east Syria to travel to Australia, their status and travel plans have been at the centre of a political maelstrom. The Albanese government has insisted there would be no repatriation of the...
